intro: Spermacoce simplicicaulis, commonly known as the simple-stemmed gooseberry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Spermacoce simplicicaulis is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
